intro: Hiptage malaiensis, commonly known as the Malabar hiptage, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of southern Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a velvety texture, while its flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the branches. Hiptage malaiensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
